body: Following up on one of the questions up top about whether there's anything special about `/private/var/tmp` for Bazel on macOS, I noticed that updating the OS causes this location to be blown away. I would understand if this location was chosen with this or a related fact in mind. If this is a coincidence or unimportant, I'd love to have this option on macOS (particularly because environment variables are not interpolated in `.bazelrc` as far as I'm aware, so I have to hardcode the path in the absence of this).

See https://chatgpt.com/share/67a33ebf-0508-8013-ac91-478bb2ca0563

Have you tried `--output_base` and `--output_user_root` to set Bazel's output paths? See also https://bazel.build/remote/output-directories#layout

Yes, but as I said, I can't set `startup --output_user_root=${XDG_CACHE_DIR}/bazel` in my `$HOME/.bazelrc` because environment variables are not interpolated in bazelrc. I have to hardcode it to a known fixed value, in this case `startup --output_user_root=~/.cache/bazel`. It would be nice for macOS to get the same environment-respecting feature that Linux has, if the environment variable is set â€“ even if XDG adoption isn't as widespread on macOS as it is Linux, it's both valid to do so and not uncommon.
OK, I cannot think of any reason to forbidden this, are you willing to contribute a PR to Bazel to add this support?
Yeah, I'm willing to try! I was actually just in the middle of standing up a dev environment for #25165, which is the higher priority at the $dayjob.

issue.title: Respect XDG directory settings on macOS

Fixes #25167

Copies much of the logic over from `blaze_util_linux.cc` and its tests into the Darwin space to implement the feature request.

issue.title: Move default output root on macOS to `$HOME/Library/Caches`

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Description of the feature request:


Forking from #25167 and its implementation in #25205, it was requested during code review that the default output root on macOS be moved from the historically relevant `/private/var/tmp` to the more conventional `$HOME/Library/Caches`. This issue serves to track that implementation.

As a relatively new contributor, it's unclear if this is would be an incompatible change, though based on the fact I can't see any incompatible startup options, I am assuming it's either atypical or not supported in the release model. Happy to roll this out in any way a contributor sees fit for it to be. 

### Which category does this issue belong to?

Core

### What underlying problem are you trying to solve with this feature?


_No response_

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


macOS 15.3.1

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.0.1

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


```text
git@github.com:aaronsky/bazel.git
95bbed03758a7651916d0708a892f5342a0421c5
```

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

_No response_

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

_No response_
